results.title: Motion Graphics Designer
results.description:
Levitate Foundry is an award-winning eCommerce growth marketing firm and early-stage brand foundry. We work with brands across CPG/CE/Beauty/Wellness/Health/Fashion, in both Hardlines and Softlines categories, across the world, to implement innovative growth marketing strategies and executional media buying for our clients. We also have a brand strategy and UX/UI arm (including design, creative, and advertising production teams). We are looking for an experienced marketing professional to lead Account Management and Strategy Implementation for Performance Creative, reporting to the Director of Content and Performance Creative. Find past brands we've worked with at: www.levitatefoundry.com.

Requirements

  • Lead performance creative initiatives and produce high volume of ad creative to drive measurable results for brand adoption and customer acquisition
  • Create videos and gifs for a wide range of clients
  • Support the day-to-day account management of our Creative clients and take full ownership on all account activities.
  • Propose, develop, design, and manage creative templates, mockups, and other design/production efficiencies to be shared with other designers and external partners, as needed.
  • Strategically translate business opportunities into advertising and performance content strategies to effectively communicate to customers throughout their journey.
  • Pivoting to change course or adjust ideas to address new feedback and guidance
  • Understand what’s working in current ads and why
  • Writing compelling creative briefs and working closely with creative teams to develop work that makes an impact
  • Guide the advertising creative process, and lead the team to deliver on the winning creative
  • Ideate best concepts and encourage others to contribute winning ideas
  • Check in and manage projects as they move through the creative and media teams
  • Send updates and conduct calls with the accounts assigned to ensure consistent communication
  • Ensure that clients are delivering all assets and responses per timeline


What You Bring

  • Experience in Performance Creative working on creative assets for Meta, YouTube, TikTok, Pinterest, and Twitter
  • You have 1-2 years of minimum experience at different eCommerce or digitally native brands, at a digital marketing agency, or in a social media marketing and/or brand partnerships role
  • Proficiency in all relevant design software, including but not limited to Adobe Creative Cloud [Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop, Lightroom, XD—familiarity with Dimension, Premiere Pro, and After Effects are a plus], Sketch, Figma, Keynote, G Suite applications, etc.
  • Experience with a project management platform like Asana or monday.com
  • Experience across a variety of industries and verticals with the ability to bridge a connection between business needs, creative vision, and consumer interests.
  • Experience working with Instagram, Facebook, Google, Twitter, YouTube, Pinterest, etc. and understanding their analytics/insights
  • You have knowledge of online and offline marketing, managing and building community and an active following, creative best practices, and have the ability to be creative
  • You have good Client services skills and the ability to present your thoughts and presentations effectively
  • Passion for smart and engaging storytelling, social listening, and creating meaningful or empowering experiences for a diverse audience
  • Highly organized, detail-oriented and media-savvy
  • You are able to work in a fast-paced, exciting environment and across external and internal teams to deliver top results to Clients. You are a team player, smart, adapt well to change, and have a positive attitude

Benefits

  • Competitive Salary
  • Fully Remote Workplace
  • Medical, Dental & Vision
  • 401k
  • Life
  • PTO Policy

results.title: Senior Product Designer
results.description:
We are ThinkShout, a fully distributed, certified B Corp dedicated to delivering exceptional web development, design, user experience, and strategy to the nonprofits and forward-thinking organizations that inspire us.

We're looking for a Senior Product Designer to lead project work, inspire our clients, and engage in shaping our design team in a time of critical department growth.. User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and inspiring communication. You’ll collaborate with fellow designers and departments to create innovative design solutions that have a greater impact for our clients.

Requirements

Qualifications:
  • 5+ years of relevant industry experience, designing large-scale websites and engaging digital products
  • A visual thinker with strong color, typographic, and UX/UI skills with a knack for design systems
  • Advanced level of proficiency with design programs like Figma and Adobe Creative Suite
  • Knowledge of how designs are applied in HTML and CSS as well as CMS platforms; Wordpress and Drupal are a plus
  • A deep understanding of accessible, inclusive and user-centered design practices
  • An awareness of the inherent white supremacy of design thinking and actively making efforts to decolonize one’s individual design practice
  • Strong communication skills, ability to present and defend work to peers and executive-level stakeholders
  • Experience working with existing brands and design systems in order to maintain brand voice and visual identity; Brand design experience a plus
  • Experience creating reusable components & design patterns to scale and fit variety of content and technical requirements as well as in-line with project budgets
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and an agile self-starter, able to contribute to projects with varying levels of direction, and pivot flexibly as project plans shift
  • Experience working independently and on multidisciplinary teams, and collaborating with strategists, developers and other designers in supporting large-scale projects
  • Dedication and self-management skills; Experience mentoring fellow designers a plus

Bonus Points:
  • Front-end development experience
  • Motion, video, interactive storytelling examples

Essential Responsibilities:
  • Owning and leading projects while collaborating closely with strategists, developers, and other designers to ideate, iterate, and bring innovative and intuitive solutions to the table
  • Building and maintaining creative offerings for ThinkShout's client work, participating in all UX and visual design stages of a project from concept through final hand-off to our development team, and serving as design advisor through implementation
  • Working within established brands and design systems; expanding them where needed
  • Creating, organizing, and documenting all your designs in Figma with extreme detail
  • Managing your time between projects of varying size and complexity with a dedicated focus to elevating your craft

Benefits

The Fine Print

ThinkShout is a fully distributed company and we welcome applications from candidates who have the unrestricted right to work in the USA.

ThinkShout is primarily a time and materials agency. In the role of Senior Product Designer, there is a weekly expectation of 30 billable hours. We work hard to maintain a 40 hour work week and we’re committed to supporting flexible schedules.

The salary band for this position is $80-105k. In addition, we offer a comprehensive benefits package, including:

  • Health insurance with dental, vision, and alternative care
  • Company funded Health Reimbursement Account
  • 401k with a 3% company contribution and no matching requirement
  • Quarterly Profit Share program
  • Life insurance and short term disability insurance
  • Paid Family and Medical Leave
  • 32 days of PTO annually, including holidays
  • Paid sabbatical after 5 years with the company
  • Professional development funds
  • Excellent management support and a well thought-out yearly review process


ThinkShout is made up of people with a variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all walks of life. We recognize that our company isn't as diverse as it should be and we're trying to change that. If you aren't sure whether you qualify, please apply anyway. We would much prefer to have an extra application to consider than for you to screen yourself out. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status or any other differences. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process better (jobs@thinkshout.com). We are happy to accommodate.


Next Steps

Please submit a resume (no more than 2 pages) in PDF format. We request that you do not submit a cover letter. In its place, we have a few questions for you to answer in the job application. These questions will help us learn more about you and are an integral component of the interview process.

If you are selected to move forward, here’s what you can expect:

  • Round 1 is a 25-minute screening call
  • Round 2 is a 55-minute panel interview in which you will present a project from your portfolio followed by a Q&A
  • Round 3 is a 45-minute finalist interview

We are looking to fill this position for a January start date.

Please note that candidates must reside and be eligible to work in the United States.

results.title: UI Design Tutors and Mentors (f/m/d)
results.description:
We created CareerFoundry to help others build their careers while maintaining personal freedom and flexibility. Our 100% online, flexible, mentor/tutor driven courses are setting the standard for globally accessible technical education. Through our online programs, expert tutors and mentors bring students from complete beginners to junior UI designers in 6 months.

We are searching for experienced and passionate UI designers to join our pool of experts. Help define the next generation of design talent by educating and empowering students across the globe while working remotely and around your own schedule!

Your Mission:

Mentoring with CareerFoundry is more than teaching. It’s inspiring newcomers to the field to build, to problem solve, to think like a designer, and to increase their value as professionals.

**Based on your application and experience, we will make a decision on whether the Tutor or Mentor role is the perfect fit for you.

Mentor role:

Students need more than help and experience to master the necessary skills, they need inspiration and motivation to keep them focused along the way. You're their point of entry into a new industry, so they’ll want to hear about challenges you have overcome and what the role is really like on a day-to-day basis.

Tasks:

  • Reviewing your students’ work through the CareerFoundry platform on a regular basis with a view on how it would fit into an industry-ready portfolio.
  • Be available for 1-to-1 video calls to help prepare your students entry into their new industry.
  • Suggesting supplemental learning materials and personal insights in areas where students are struggling.
  • Teaming up with a tutor to answer more advanced queries or for a higher level of troubleshooting.
  • Responding to students within < 48 hours.

Tutor role:

Tutors give vital feedback on assignments through written reviews guided by our course curriculum and rubrics. When students are struggling with understanding a key area, tutors are there to support and encourage them, sharing resources and providing insights into the industry.

Tasks:

  • Regularly reviewing student exercises submitted through the CareerFoundry platform.
  • Submission reviews and checking for fundamental understanding of concepts.
  • Suggesting supplemental learning materials and personal insights in areas where students are struggling.
  • Working with a mentor who will advise the student specifically on career-related topics and support you as a tutor.
  • Responding to students within < 24 hours.

Requirements

To succeed, you must enjoy sharing your knowledge and be willing to work with students from beginner level onwards.

Mentor role:

  • Experience in the field as a Senior UI Designer, Creative Lead, Product Design Lead, Art Director, and a demonstrable track record showcasing your work for a variety of clients and companies.
  • A portfolio demonstrating your skill and examples of professional projects. Professional references may be required.
  • Previous experience in mentorship or tutoring is preferred. You must demonstrate an understanding of how to support beginners, have time and patience and a strong desire to guide people along their career path in this field.
  • Knowledge of the latest development tools and trends, a broad network of experts in the field and an in-depth understanding of industry practices.
  • Fluent in English.

Tutor role:

  • 2+ years experience in the field, working as a (Junior to Mid-Level) UI designer.
  • A great portfolio.
  • In depth knowledge of industry best practices.
  • A strong desire to help others.
  • Fluent in English.

Benefits

  • 100% Remote and flexible - work from anywhere with an internet connection, and around your schedule.
  • A freelance contract with a competitive rate.
  • Shape the industry by developing the next generation of designers.
  • Resume gold – mentoring experience is highly sought after by employers.

CareerFoundry is an equal opportunity employer. It is our commitment that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. We encourage in particular BiPoC, Migrants, people from under-represented communities, people who identify as queer, trans, and/ or intersex, people
with chronic illnesses, and people with disabilities to apply!


For inquiries please contact the team at talent.instructors@careerfoundry.com

We're looking forward to hearing from you!

results.title: UX Designer
results.description:
About Grio

Founded in 2008, Grio prides itself in being a premier full-service web and mobile software consulting agency based in San Francisco, CA. So, why join Grio? As a remote-work first company, Grio is committed to hiring teams with diverse backgrounds for the purpose of promoting creativity, and believes great ideas come from teams with various perspectives. This means you get to work with team members located across the globe – from Mexico City to New York and everything in between.

Our employees boast about the positive collaboration they experience with their teammates and the company’s commitment to work/life flexibility. This speaks volumes to Grio’s year over year growth , repeat clients, and even repeat employees! We take an empathic approach to ensure that we’re delivering the best possible products to our clients, and use that same lens to create a culture of engagement for our employees.

About the Role

Grio is looking for a fully remote, full-time, UX Designer to join our design team. In this role, you will have an exciting opportunity to work on interesting and complex problems across a variety of industries. This is what to expect during your first year with Grio as a UX Designer:

  • You will complete 3-4 UX projects for a variety of clients and industries including but not limited to Insurance, Architecture, Ecommerce, and Manufacturing.
  • You will learn how Grio project teams of designers, product and project managers, QA engineers, and software developers work together to deliver high quality products and solutions to clients.
  • You will build a relationship with the Grio design team through team meetings and project work. The design team is a close knit group of designers who encourage, support, and learn from each other.
  • You will meet Grio employees through project work, All Hands meetings, and other Grio sponsored virtual and in-person social activities.
  • You will maintain Grio’s high standards of communication with your ability to actively listen to clients to strengthen relationships and build trust.

Requirements

About You

You ideally have previous experience working with clients or in a design agency, can work independently and autonomously, pivot easily and run in a different direction when needed, and can receive constructive feedback without losing momentum. We are seeking someone who enjoys simplifying complex workflows, advocating for users, has problem-solving and active listening skills with the ability to ask critical questions of clients, and can communicate designs and their nuances to engineers and stakeholders. You should have strong experience working with a distributed workforce in a highly-collaborative environment. To be considered, please answer the screening questions and share your resume. A portfolio is optional to apply.

  • 4+ years of experience in a client-facing role, preferably in an agency setting, with proven success communicating design concepts, rationale, and technical terminology to clients
  • Extensive experience with the following:
    • Planning interviews and user testing, moderating feedback sessions, analysis, and applying the insights to UX deliverables
    • Creating UX deliverables such as site maps, user flows, and both low- and high- fidelity wireframes
    • Designing for web, responsive web, and native mobile platforms
    • Writing UX documentation that allows the development team to implement solutions successfully
    • Collaborating with cross-functional teams (fellow designers, product managers, developers) to create and deliver designs solutions that meet project requirements
  • Experience with Figma

Grio is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. You will not be discriminated against based on your age, race, gender, sexual orientation, sexual identity, religion, disability, veteran status, national origin, marital status or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.

If you love what you do and want to work hard to build innovative software then we encourage you to please apply!

Benefits

  • Enjoy the flexibility of working on different projects, technologies and industries for different clients.
  • 100% paid health and wellness benefits; 50% paid for spouses and dependents.
  • An educational allowance that coincides with the company’s life-long commitment to learning and development for all of its staff.
  • Compensation packages that let you share in the company’s long-term success.
  • A 5% 401(k) company match – that’s free money in your pocket!
  • Sick days & a generous vacation policy – the longer your tenure, the more vacay time you accrue.

results.title: Mid/Senior Technical Artist(s)
results.description:
Company Description

City State Entertainment is an independent video game development studio founded in March 2011, in Fairfax, Virginia, by online gaming pioneer Mark Jacobs and engineer extraordinaire, Andrew Meggs. Several years later, our Seattle studio was founded and is run by another extraordinary engineer, George Davison. The studio embodies an “open office” collaborative process where all team members are expected to contribute to the design and the development process. The team has built a next-generation engine tentatively titled the "Unchained Engine" which is powering their two games in development - Camelot Unchained, a niche RvR old-school MMORPG (currently in Beta) and Final Stand: Ragnarok, a PvE looter-slasher in which teams of any size fight against hordes of NPCs (currently in very Early Access on Steam).



Job Description

We are currently looking for creative and driven technical artists to join us to support our art and rendering team. Our interest includes not just generalist Tech Artists, but also any experienced tech artists with specialities.

Examples:
Tech Artist - Pipeline/tools
Tech Artist - Shaders/Materials
Tech Artist - Animator - Rigging

So if you’re a tech artist with the vision to develop tools, passion for finding technical solutions and improving pipelines or are render focused with drive and skills to develop shaders and material effects, we are interested across the board.

Role and Responsibilities:
Technical Artists are a critical role that will work together with artists and engineers to drive the visual development of our projects forward, with the opportunity to be part of direction and vision, as well as guiding other artists. Collaborating with artists and others roles may include: generating high quality shaders, materials, scripts and rigs. Designs and developing improved content creation pipelines and workflows.



Qualifications

What we are looking for:
• 2 or more years in games development in a technical art role
• Intimately familiar with physically based rendering, shaders (HLSL), and physically based material systems
• Cognizance of new graphics techniques and ability to drive meaningful improvements to the overall graphical quality of the game.
• Experience working with developers to update tools and pipeline processes for artists.
• Solid understanding of Substance Suite, Zbrush, and Maya.
• Experience with optimization for performant art without sacrificing visual fidelity and quality.
• Able to resolve unique technical challenges in creative and novel manner.
• Great time management and ability to work with deadlines and multiple competing priorities.
• Strong communication ability particularly between engineers and artists.



Additional Information

Bonus:
• Strong knowledge of the MMO industry and PC gaming industry
• Able to provide concise critique and feedback to help raise other artists' skill level.
• C++ and/or engineering experience.
• Understanding of the process of rigging and animation creation, as well as animation techniques.


Note: City State Entertainment is hiring for a broad range of positions on a growing team. We have definite skill and task needs, but the eventual division of tasks within the team will depend on the eventual team members. If you’re an outstanding and talented individual whose qualifications fall halfway between two of our listings, we’d still like to hear from you. All candidates must have excellent communication skills. We prefer candidates who can work on-site at either of our Washington DC/Seattle area offices in the U.S.A. Due to COVID-19, all employees are currently working remotely for the time being. Candidates who are hired as "remote only" team members will not ever be required to relocate to either area. We are an emphatically equal-opportunity employer.

results.title: Sr. UX Designer
results.description:
Netomi is an AI-first customer service platform that enables companies to deliver the highest quality customer experiences while significantly reducing cost. Netomi's Relationship Operating System automatically resolves up to 80% of routine customer service inquiries, decreasing resolution time, and increasing customer satisfaction and support quality. The patented, no-code platform works across messaging, chat, email and voice, and understands 100+ languages. Netomi is based in San Francisco and has offices in New York and India.
 
Want to have a direct impact in solving the top challenges businesses face today? Join us!
 
You’ll be responsible for creating and conducting user research, interviews and surveys, and translating them into sitemaps, wireframes and prototypes that will be used by our Engineering team to build a world class product.
 
You will make an impact on the overall design and functionality of the Netomi platform and iterate upon it to ensure a great user experience. You will work closely with Product, Engineering and Customer Sucess teams to help build a leading-edge experience for our customers. Preference will be given to candidates based in the Toronto area.



Responsibilities:
  • Facilitate product design by researching, conceiving, wire-framing, sketching, prototyping, and mocking up user experiences for our platform.
  • Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to existing and new functions and features based on hands-on user research, or by designing options for an A/B test.
  • Work closely with product managers to understand requirements and develop high level and detailed storyboards, mockups and prototypes, to effectively communicate interaction, design, product and user goals.
  • Translate concepts into wireframes and high quality design deliverables  to be used by the engineering team to build products.
  • Work closely with developers to address design implementation challenges.
  • Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions with a user-centered design approach
  • Rapidly test and iterate your designs.
  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
  • Take smart risks and champion new ideas that lead to intuitive user experiences.
  • Act as a UX mentor and guide to our current and future UX designers.
  • Document findings, improvements and processes, as needed.



Requirements:
  • Overall 6+ years of relevant experience working as a UX designer, and 4+ years in B2B SaaS products/platforms, complex enterprise platforms.
  • Proficient in interaction design, user testing, and user research techniques – using research and data to drive high-value product decisions.
  • With a strong attention to detail, you are data driven and use quantitative as well as qualitative data sources to inform your design decisions.
  • Ability to collaborate and communicate effectively with product managers and engineers.
  • Clear communication skills and an ability to tell compelling stories and articulate the rationale behind your design decisions.
  • Strong sketching skills and can move seamlessly from low-fidelity whiteboard scribbles and paper sketches to high-fidelity mockups and prototypes.
  • Intimately familiar with the latest user-centered design trends and methodologies, setting up and working with design systems.
  • An expert with Figma and/or Sketch and Sketch-related tools (Abstract, Zeplin, InVision), Photoshop, Illustrator, and various other tools.
  • Planning and integrating concepts into a broad range of visual planning/ presentational/ business tools – Miro, Microsoft Office, Google Workspace, etc.
  • Experience with UX project planning tools such as Jira, Trello, Monday.
  • Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, Javascript, JQuery and other front-end markup languages
  • A diverse digital portfolio that shows just how good you are with interaction design, user experience, typography, colors, layouts and images.
  • Design Degree (Visual communication, Graphic Design, Interaction Design or Human Computer Interaction or Anthropology) or equivalent experience/strong portfolio.



Additional Awesomeness:
  • Experience working with multiple design and/or development teams in different time zones
  • UI experience in building, uplifting and/or maintaining a design library of components, demonstrating a strong understanding of patterns and pixel-perfect consistency.
Netomi is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

results.title: Product Designer
results.description:
We’re on the lookout for an experienced product-oriented designer! Sound like your kind of thing? Join an excellent team of motivated design enthusiasts, and turn your day job into something you love. We’ll be happy to check out your portfolio and get back to you!

Who We Are

First, a bit about us. STRV is a software design and engineering team that delivers next-level products. Here since 2004, we’ve delivered solutions for partners ranging from startups to enterprises, including Barry’s, Microsoft, MedMen, Barnes & Noble, The Athletic, Autodesk, and more.

We focus on mobile applications, websites, backend infrastructure, IoT, blockchain, and data science/ML/AI. We have a footprint in specialized domains like dating, crypto, and mobile gaming. On top of that, we’ve also got some successful internal spin-off projects (like Surge and Zoe), with more in the works — including a space western multiplayer NFT game. Feel free to ask us all about them.

The culture is very open and friendly, with everyone on the team self-driven in delivering the highest possible value for clients — because we all care about building partnerships and creating products that make us proud. But you’ve probably scrolled our web and read about all that already. 

How You Fit In

You’ll be joining our Design team and will be working on projects that usually last around 3 months and can involve design, development, QA, and product management. Usually, you can expect to work on only one project at a time and be involved from start to finish.

International Community

A few things to know: STRV people represent about 26 nationalities, so our official language is English. For people that decide to relocate to the Czech Republic, we’re always happy to provide visa sponsorships and relocation support. And as for meeting our US clients, there may be times you’ll get to visit them — or you may see them strolling through our Prague office since they’re often curious to see the STRV in action and to meet their team in person.

Learning & Other Opportunities

With over 9 designers, a team lead and a creative director, there’s always someone to consult, have a design feedback session with and learn from. We also host a couple of meetups and workshops, and our designers have a generous conference budget. The occasional trip to conferences worldwide is absolutely on the table.

And, in line with our knowledge-sharing mindset, we are all working in Figma, where you can see what everybody is working on in real-time.

At STRV, Your Role Will Be To
  • Confidently describe your design solutions to our clients at all levels
  • Be responsible for the whole design output on a given project
  • Collaborate with other designers on projects
  • Perform as a fearless team player, as you’ll also be collaborating with other departments and supporting them until the project is fully finished
  • Provide constructive feedback to other designers to help them move forward
We Expect You To Have
  • A user-centered product design approach
  • A natural drive that will fit in with our always curious, tight-knit team; open, honest communication, and the ability to learn are a must
  • Multiple years of experience in the industry and a mind full of ideas ready to be put into action
  • The ability to start a project with user flows and wireframes, visually perfecting its UI and finishing it by prototyping and presenting to a client independently
  • Experience with Figma
  • Confident English on a high level; due to our primarily US-based clientele, our designers present and consult their work in English
Perks & Benefits

We want you to feel at home. Our benefits help make sure that you remain productive, have all the tools you need, and stay in great shape both mentally and physically. Here’s what we offer:

  • Flexible working hours 
  • MacBook Pro laptop
  • External display, extra charger, and accessories
  • AirPods or alternative headphones
  • Occasional trips to Czech Republic
  • Conferences, meetups, language lessons, seminars to support personal growth
  • Themed events and team buildings to cultivate the spirit of STRV

results.title: UX/UI designer (M/F)
results.description:
Our company

SantéVet is the market leader in pet health insurance in France and Belgium, with established operations in Germany and Spain. SantéVet was founded in 2003 in Lyon by Jérôme Salord, and now employs around 450 people in Lyon, Lille, Barcelona and Frankfurt. SantéVet offers a simple but comprehensive suite of pet health insurance solutions that are renewed annually and cover illness, accidents and prevention through three complementary brands: SantéVet, Bulle Bleue and Jim & Joe.

 

Your working environment

Permanent contract (CDI).

Ideal location: Lyon, Barcelona

Your working days: Monday to Friday

 

Your responsibility

As a UX-UI designer inside the Product team, you will be the responsible of the user interaction of our different products and brands. Not only making them look appealing but intuitive and easy to use. You would be the first piece involved in the product lifecycle: from understanding the business case and user problem to driving the user experience strategy. You will be working close to the Product Owners and developers to deliver user-focused experiences. The main responsibilities for the role are the following:

 

  • You contribute to creating rich and fluid customer experiences on our websites and our mobile apps. You enjoy creating engaging customer experiences on both purchase and customer journeys
  • You can put yourself in the shoes of your personas and offer personalized journeys. Meeting customer needs is of crucial importance to you, and you are keen to join a company that puts customer satisfaction and their pets at the heart of its strategy
  • You design wireframes, user flows, information architecture and prototypes as well as UI interface and mock-ups for sites and mobile applications considering the responsive design of all devices
  • You lead ideation project workshops with business stakeholders and user research activities such as user interviews, usability tests and A/B tests
  • Solicit and engage in regular design feedback and be able to iterate designs and solutions efficiently to address input
  • You rely on internal webanalytics experts for the site and mobile applications to identify friction points and areas for improvement.
  • Collaborate inside a Product squad, closely linked to the Product Owner and interacting with engineers to ensure design solutions are thoroughly understood and are technically feasible

 

 

Your profile

- 4/5 years of higher education in graphic design or related field

- 3 years of UX-UI experience in a similar position

- Successful experience in redesigning e-commerce sites, mobile applications and conversion funnels

- Highly skilled use of design tools such as Figma, AdobeXD, Photoshop, Illustrator and InVision

- Fluency in spoken and written English. A good level of French is a huge plus

- Experience with agile software development methodologies in close partnership with design and engineering colleagues

- Team player. Ability to work on multiple, simultaneous projects of all sizes and complexity across multiple platforms

- Excellent facilitation, collaboration and empathy skills

- Accept and act on constructive criticism.

- Also valued SEO and accessibility knowledge

- Stay up to date on emerging and best UX/UI trends and incorporate top UX design standards

 

Our benefits

We do everything possible to ensure that our employees arrive in the morning with a smile on their faces (and leave in the evening...). This is a challenge that has been more than met, as we have to make a point of honor of the low turnover in our company!

With us, you will find:

 

⋆ A pet-friendly environment in all our offices.

⋆ Great financial rewards: a generous package in line with your monthly performance, ticket restaurant, and ticket transport.

⋆ A caring and friendly environment,

⋆ A dynamic context with a nice double-digit growth,

⋆ Spacious and pleasant premises,

⋆ Local management,

⋆ Teleworking days,

⋆ Great colleagues who are passionate, like you!

 

At SantéVet, we celebrate diversity and inclusion and encourage you to be authentic! SantéVet does not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability or marital status.

 

You’re still unsure to apply?

⋆ 96% are satisfied to work at SantéVet

⋆ 98% are happy about divided between personal life and professional life

⋆ 95% work in a good atmosphere

⋆ 96% of people recommend to work at SantéVet

 

"Priority to disabled workers and other beneficiaries of the employment obligation with equal skills"

results.title: 3D Animator Graphic Designer
results.description:
About the 3D Animator position

A 3D animator uses images, figures, and symbols to help bring a brand's concept to life. You will work with a creative graphics team and marketing teams to storyboard and design ideas, translate concepts into moving imagery, and deliver all assets needed to produce the 3D animation.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Communicate with the clients and/or creative director to understand the concept and requirements of a project
  • Draw sketches and develop storyboards according to the script
  • Create 2D models of the sketches in the computer and modify the design if required
  • Work with the creative team for character design and discuss the changes that will enhance the appearance of the sequence as a whole
  • Add background, sound, texture, colors, lighting and other attributes to an animation
  • Create separate frames for each sequence and put the sequence on timeline to match the script and soundtrack
  • Edit and fine tune the animation sequence and ensure that the final product meets the project requirements
  • Other ad hoc tasks

Qualifications and Skills:

  • 2+ years' experience of working as 3D Animator / Graphic Designer or other similar position
  • Excellent graphic design skills with a strong portfolio
  • Creative flair, versatility, conceptual/visual ability and originality
  • Good practical experience with industry leading software and technologies, such as In Design, Illustrator, Dreamweaver, - - Photoshop and so on
  • Strong abilities to comply with requirements of time, costs and deadlines
  • Can work 4 to 6 hours a day following Eastern Standard Time (EST) Schedule

Requirements

As you will be working from home, please be advised that we will require you to prepare certain Technical Requirements for you to meet the industry standard.

  • A dedicated secluded working space away from noise and any distractions
  • Updated personal computer or laptop with webcam
  • Stable internet connection of at least 5Mbps and a backup of a pocket WiFi or Mobile Data

results.title: Lead Technical Artist
results.description:
Lead Technical Artist

IllFonic is looking for a Lead Technical Artist to build and lead a team of technical artists for the various IPs here at IllFonic. The role requires an experienced technically minded individual that has lead tech-art teams in the past. This person is adept at establishing pipelines and standards as well as identifying the strengths and weaknesses of their team. In addition to leading the team, the candidate will also create tools, shaders and scripts while adhering to schedules and project goals. This role is a team leader and will have great communication skills, written and oral. If this sounds like you, apply today and we will reach out with next steps.

About the Company

Founded in 2007, IllFonic is an independent video game developer and publisher with studios in Lakewood, Colorado, Tacoma, Washington, and Austin, Texas. Our staff is composed of video game, music, and technology veterans redefining how indie and middle-market games are made and marketed. Current and past titles / collaborations include Ghostbusters: Spirits Unleashed, Arcadegeddon, Predator: Hunting Grounds, Friday the 13th: The Game, Dead Alliance, Star Citizen, Evolve, Armored Warfare, and Nexuiz.

Responsibilities
  • Lead team members in areas of expertise; instill best practices
  • Working with Producers to estimate the duration of tech art tasks, and then enforcing deliverables and standards
  • Propose solutions and optimize content for memory and performance concerns on PC and Consoles
  • Develop and maintain art asset pipelines and collaborate with the art team to optimize workflows, authoring new tools as necessary
  • Be proactive, develop and implement new ideas/solutions to problems as they arise
  • Advise on emerging graphics technology while assessing its usefulness within current pipeline and schedules 
  • Assist in various areas of game art production to help assure the timely delivery of the product
    Requirements
    • Portfolio of work demonstrating strong proficiency as a Technical Artist
    • Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Graphic Art or a related field or equivalent experience
    • Must have a minimum of 6 years experience with at least 3 shipped titles (one or more shipped titles as a Lead)
    • Solid understanding of artist workflows and toolsets 
    • Proficiency in artist workflows and toolsets (e.g. Maya, 3Dsmax, Photoshop, ect...)
    • Proficient in one (or more) of the following:  C++, Python / PySide or MEL 
    • Familiar with UE4 blueprints or equivalent visual scripting
    • Ability to create simple and complex shader graphs, as well as the optimization of those shaders
    • Optimizing Art Assets (Environment, Character, Props, VFX and Rigs) 
    • Proactive and solution orientated
    • Well-developed troubleshooting skills - must able to quickly identify and resolve art issues and demonstrate versatility
    • Strong  communication skills, both written and verbal
    • A customer first mentality
    • A passion for games
    Bonus
    • Tool support for Art, Tech, or Animation teams to help automate tasks or assist workflow
    • Ability to write clean, maintainable and extensible code with attention to reusability
    • Proficiency with Blender, Houdini, Substance Painter and/or Visual Studio
    Benefits & Compensation
    • Flexible work location options including remote, hybrid or in office
    • 100% employee paid medical, dental and vision coverage + 50% coverage for dependents
    • 401k + 4% company match
    • Competitive salary in the independent game developer market, with career progression and continued education encouraged and supported by management at all levels
    • Royalty Bonus Plan paid out after each calendar quarter during the year
    • Wellness Program that rewards work-life balance
    • Unlimited PTO and almost 7 weeks of mandated time off of work annually including First Friday Wellness Days of each month, Summer Break the week of 4th of July, Winter Break the last two weeks of the year, and an additional 7 holidays during the year
    • Moonlighting allowed for all non-competitive endeavors
